verses.verse: "Behold,<WH2005> My Servant,<WH5650> whom I uphold;<WH8551> My chosen<WH972> one [in whom] My soul<WH5315> delights.<WH7521> I have put<WH5414> My Spirit<WH7307> upon Him; He will bring<WH3318> forth<WH3318> justice<WH4941> to the nations.<WH1471>
"He will not cry<WH6817> out or raise<WH5375> [His voice,<WH6963>] Nor<WH3808> make<WH8085> His voice heard<WH8085> in the street.<WH2351>

"A bruised<WH7533> reed<WH7070> He will not break,<WH7665> And a dimly<WH3544> burning wick<WH6594> He will not extinguish;<WH3518> He will faithfully<WH571> bring<WH3318> forth<WH3318> justice.<WH4941>

"He will not be disheartened<WH3543> or crushed,<WH7533> Until<WH5704> He has established<WH7760> justice<WH4941> in the earth;<WH776> And the coastlands<WH339> will wait<WH3176> expectantly<WH3176> for His law.<WH8451>"

Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> God<WH410> the Lord,<WH3068> Who created<WH1254> the heavens<WH8064> and stretched<WH5186> them out, Who spread<WH7554> out the earth<WH776> and its offspring,<WH6631> Who gives<WH5414> breath<WH5397> to the people<WH5971> on it, And spirit<WH7307> to those who walk<WH1980> in it,

"I am the Lord,<WH3068> I have called<WH7121> you in righteousness,<WH6664> I will also hold<WH2388> you by the hand<WH3027> and watch<WH5341> over you, And I will appoint<WH5414> you as a covenant<WH1285> to the people,<WH5971> As a light<WH216> to the nations,<WH1471>
To open<WH6491> blind<WH5787> eyes,<WH5869> To bring<WH3318> out prisoners<WH616> from the dungeon,<WH4525> And those who dwell<WH3427> in darkness<WH2822> from the prison.<WH1004> <WH3608>
"I am the Lord,<WH3068> that is My name;<WH8034> I will not give<WH5414> My glory<WH9202> to another,<WH312> Nor<WH3808> My praise<WH8416> to graven<WH6456> images.<WH6456>

"Behold,<WH2009> the former<WH7223> things<WH7223> have come<WH935> to pass,<WH935> Now I declare<WH5046> new<WH2319> things;<WH2319> Before<WH2962> they spring<WH6779> forth<WH6779> I proclaim<WH8085> [them] to you."

Sing<WH7891> to the Lord<WH3068> a new<WH2319> song,<WH7892> [Sing] His praise<WH8416> from the end<WH7097> of the earth!<WH776> You who go<WH3381> down<WH3381> to the sea,<WH3220> and all<WH4393> that is in it. You islands<WH339> and those who dwell<WH3427> on them.

Let the wilderness<WH4057> and its cities<WH5892> lift<WH5375> up [their voices,] The settlements<WH9161> where Kedar<WH6938> inhabits.<WH3427> Let the inhabitants<WH3427> of Sela<WH5553> sing<WH7442> aloud,<WH7442> Let them shout<WH6681> for joy<WH6681> from the tops<WH7218> of the mountains.<WH2022>
Let them give<WH7760> glory<WH9202> to the Lord,<WH3068> And declare<WH5046> His praise<WH8416> in the coastlands.<WH339>

The Lord<WH3068> will go<WH3318> forth<WH3318> like a warrior,<WH1368> He will arouse<WH5782> [His] zeal<WH7068> like a man<WH376> of war.<WH6873> He will utter<WH7321> a shout,<WH7321> yes,<WH637> He will raise<WH6873> a war cry.<WH6873> He will prevail<WH1396> against<WH5921> His enemies.<WH340>

"I have kept<WH2814> silent<WH2814> for a long<WH5769> time,<WH5769> I have kept<WH2790> still<WH2790> and restrained<WH662> Myself. [Now] like a woman in labor<WH3205> I will groan,<WH6463> I will both<WH3162> gasp<WH5395> and pant.<WH7602>

"I will lay<WH2717> waste<WH2717> the mountains<WH2022> and hills,<WH1389> And wither<WH3001> all<WH3605> their vegetation;<WH6212> I will make<WH7760> the rivers<WH5104> into coastlands,<WH339> And dry<WH3001> up the ponds.<WH98>

"And I will lead<WH1980> the blind<WH5787> by a way<WH1870> they do not know,<WH3045> In paths<WH9350> they do not know<WH3045> I will guide<WH1869> them. I will make<WH7760> darkness<WH4285> into light<WH216> before<WH6440> them And rugged<WH4625> places<WH4625> into plains.<WH4334> These<WH428> are the things<WH1697> I will do,<WH6213> And I will not leave<WH5800> them undone.<WH5800>"

They shall be turned<WH5472> back<WH268> and be utterly<WH954> put<WH954> to shame,<WH954> Who trust<WH982> in idols,<WH6459> Who say<WH559> to molten<WH4541> images,<WH4541> "You are our gods.<WH430>"
Hear,<WH8085> you deaf!<WH2795> And look,<WH5027> you blind,<WH5787> that you may see.<WH7200>

Who<WH4310> is blind<WH5787> but My servant,<WH5650> Or so deaf<WH2795> as My messenger<WH4397> whom I send<WH7971>? Who<WH4310> is so blind<WH5787> as he that is at peace<WH7999> [with Me,] Or so blind<WH5787> as the servant<WH5650> of the Lord<WH3068>?
You have seen<WH7200> many<WH7227> things,<WH7227> but you do not observe<WH8104> [them]; [Your] ears<WH241> are open,<WH6491> but none<WH3808> hears.<WH8085>
The Lord<WH3068> was pleased<WH2654> for His righteousness' sake<WH4616> To make<WH1431> the law<WH8451> great<WH1431> and glorious.<WH142>

But this<WH1931> is a people<WH5971> plundered<WH962> and despoiled;<WH8154> All<WH3605> of them are trapped<WH6351> in caves,<WH2352> Or are hidden<WH2244> away in prisons;<WH3608> They have become<WH1961> a prey<WH957> with none<WH369> to deliver<WH5337> [them,] And a spoil,<WH4933> with none<WH369> to say,<WH559> "Give<WH7725> [them] back!<WH7725>"
Who<WH4310> among you will give<WH238> ear<WH238> to this<WH384>? Who will give<WH7181> heed<WH7181> and listen<WH8085> hereafter<WH268>?

Who<WH4310> gave<WH5414> Jacob<WH3290> up for spoil,<WH4933> and Israel<WH3478> to plunderers<WH962>? Was it not the Lord,<WH3068> against whom<WH2098> we have sinned,<WH2398> And in whose ways<WH1870> they were not willing<WH14> to walk,<WH1980> And whose law<WH8451> they did not obey<WH8085>?

So He poured<WH8210> out on him the heat<WH2534> of His anger<WH639> And the fierceness<WH5807> of battle;<WH4421> And it set<WH3857> him aflame<WH3857> all<WH4480> <WH5439> around,<WH5439> Yet he did not recognize<WH3045> [it;] And it burned<WH1197> him, but he paid<WH7760> no<WH3808> attention.<WH5921> <WH3820>
